name: src/_drop.js
_drop
description: Drops the first n values of the input iterable.

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The remaining values of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The nonnegative number of values to drop.

return.description: The remaining values of the input iterable.

name: src/_tail.js
_tail
description: Returns the last n values of the input iterable in an array.

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The last n values of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The nonnegative number of values to include in the output.

return.description: The last n values of the input iterable.

name: src/_take.js
_take
description: Yields the first n elements of the input iterable.

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The first n elements of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The nonnegative number of elements to include in the output.

return.description: The first n elements of the input iterable.

name: src/_trunc.js
_trunc
description: Yields all elements of the iterable except the last n ones.

params.name: n
params.description: The nonnegative number of elements to exclude from the output.

name: src/drop.js
drop
description: Drops the first n values of the input iterable. If n is negative, behaves like {@link tail}( iterable, -n).

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The remaining values of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of values to drop.

return.description: The remaining values of the input iterable.

name: src/dropwhile.js
dropwhile
description:
Drop elements of the input iterable while the current element satisfies the
input predicate.

src/index.js
src/slice.js
slice
description: Same as map( [ i , x ] => x , filter( [ i , x ] => (new Set( range( start , stop , step ) ) ).has( i ) , enumerate( iterable ) ) );.

name: src/tail.js
tail
description: Returns the last n values of the input iterable in an array. If n is negative, behaves like {@link drop}( iterable, -n).

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The last n values of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of values to include in the output.

return.description: The last n values of the input iterable.

name: src/take.js
take
description: Yields the first n elements of the input iterable. If n is negative, behaves like {@link trunc}( iterable, -n).

unknown.tagValue: {IterableIterator} - The first n elements of the input iterable.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of elements to include in the output.

return.description: The first n elements of the input iterable.

name: src/takewhile.js
takewhile
description:
Output elements of the input iterable while the current element satisfies the
input predicate.

name: src/trunc.js
trunc

params.name: n
params.description: The number of elements to exclude from the output.

content:
:hocho: [@iterable-iterator/slice](https://iterable-iterator.github.io/slice)
==

Iterable slicing functions for JavaScript.
See [docs](https://iterable-iterator.github.io/slice/index.html).

> :warning: Depending on your environment, the code may require
> `regeneratorRuntime` to be defined, for instance by importing
> [regenerator-runtime/runtime](https://www.npmjs.com/package/regenerator-runtime).

```js
import {range} from '@iterable-iterator/range';
import {repeat} from '@iterable-iterator/repeat';
import {take, head, tail, trunc, drop} from '@iterable-iterator/slice'
take(range(10), 3); // 0 1 2
head(repeat("A"), 3); // A A A
tail(range(10), 3); // 7 8 9
trunc(range(10), 3); // 0 1 2 3 4 5 6
drop(range(10), 3); // 3 4 5 6 7 8 9

import {count} from '@iterable-iterator/count';
import {slice} from '@iterable-iterator/slice'
slice(count(), 40, 50, 3); // 40 43 46 49

import {le} from '@functional-abstraction/predicate';
import {takewhile, dropwhile} from '@iterable-iterator/slice'
takewhile(le(5), count()); // 0 1 2 3 4 5
dropwhile(le(5), count()); // 6 7 8 ...
```

[![Dependencies](https://img.shields.io/david/iterable-iterator/slice.svg)](https://david-dm.org/iterable-iterator/slice)

[![GitHub issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues/iterable-iterator/slice.svg)](https://github.com/iterable-iterator/slice/issues)

name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs),
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com),
or [jspm](https://jspm.org/docs).


### yarn
```terminal
yarn add @iterable-iterator/slice
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @iterable-iterator/slice --save
```

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@iterable-iterator/slice
```

name: ./doc/manual/usage.md
